page.title: 04MAYS COPPICE FARM
page.content: Acreage: 200 acres + 100 acres of Southleigh Forest. There is a Farm Manager in charge here, as the owner has other farms in the area. The land is all put down to grass to provide pasture for the pedigree herd of Simmental cattle they breed for beef production.90 acres is let out for the use of a herd of pedigree Friesian cattle. They are self sufficient in providing food for their cattle during the winter, and to this end they cut silage and hay from the land. The cattle are kept in covered yards during the winter, and sheep are imported from other parts of the country to crop the grass during that season. The Lavant streams run through this area, and although the land is quite well drained, the farm gets very damp.
